event.title: 2010 U.S. Census. The community from which the city of Bartlett grew

data.event: The population was 54,613 at the 2010 U.S. Census. The community from which the city of Bartlett grew was first called Union Depot and Green Bottom.
It was the last major way station in Tennessee along the stagecoach route from Nashville westward and came into being about 1830.

event.title: November 1, 1866, with a population of less than 100, the city was officially incorporated

data.event: On November 1, 1866, with a population of less than 100, the city was officially incorporated and the name changed to Bartlett.
